story.text: CHICAGO Jan 3 Walgreen Co. WAG.N, the largest U.S. drugstore chain, said on Wednesday that sales at its stores open at least a year rose 7.9 percent in December, driven by stronger sales of prescription medications despite the $4 generic plan in place at Wal-Mart Stores Inc. (WMT.N) and other low-priced chains. Total sales rose 14.4 percent to $5.13 billion. Pharmacy same-store sales rose 9.6 percent, while same-store sales of general, or front-end, merchandise rose 5.8 percent. Pharmacy sales accounted for 56.8 percent of sales in the month, Deerfield, Illinois-based Walgreen said.
story.title: walgreen december same - store sales up 7 . 9 percent
